summary: Feature request to add native sticky sessions support to the TypeScript SDK to ensure all tasks of a workflow execute on the same worker, enabling workflows with local state. Closed as duplicate of temporalio/features#562 with indication that sessions will be redesigned across all SDKs.
userImpact: Users needing workflows with local state must implement manual sticky execution mechanisms instead of having native SDK support like Go SDK provides.
rootCause: TypeScript SDK lacks native sticky sessions implementation that Go SDK has, forcing users to build custom solutions.
proposedFix: Implement native sticky sessions in TypeScript SDK based on reference implementation using WorkerRegistrationService, HeartbeatService, and WorkflowBalancerService with worker capacity tracking.
workaround: Use Worker Specific Task Queue pattern as mentioned in samples, though it requires complex user-land implementation with limited concurrency control.
resolutionDetails: Closed as duplicate of temporalio/features#562. Team acknowledged the feature's value but declined this specific implementation, indicating sessions will be redesigned holistically across all SDKs when implemented.
keyQuote: So yes, we do intend to add Sessions support at some point. And when we do, we'll add it to _all_ of our official SDKs, not only TypeScript.
